text: hi guys it's Elise for my cupcake
addiction on today's episode I'm going
to be showing you how to make some kind
of unassuming safari style cupcakes
we're going to do leopards and we're
going to do Tigers we're going to top
them off with some gorgeous free
printable cupcake wrappers I've got
little toppers that I'll be showing you
how to make but the best thing about
these cupcakes is when you bite into
them they're animal print all the way
through let's get started to recreate
these gorgeous cupcakes you can see the
cupcake tray and I've just lined by with
some black cupcake liners I've also got
them about perfectly pipeable
buttercream frosting in plain vanilla I
will leave a link to this recipe in the
description box below but I've got that
in a disposable piping bag with an open
round piping tip I've got some
unsweetened cocoa you can also use brown
food coloring some candy melt in orange
and also in white I've got my printable
Safari themed cupcake wrappers so I will
leave a link to those in description box
below
I've also got a paintbrush some Ziploc
bags I've got a couple of small spoons
and a large spoon over here I've got
some food color in black and also orange
a pair of scissors I'm just going to use
a packet cake mix today but any vanilla
or white cake mix you like a spare Bowl
and some sticky tape
so first up you want to make up your
cake mix like I said I'm using a packet
cake mix but whatever recipe you're
comfortable using so long as it's a
vanilla or a white cake mix it's going
to do the trick once your cake mix is
all mixed I'm going to take two
good-sized tablespoons of that mixer put
it into one Bowl and then four
good-sized tablespoons of the same
mixture and put it into the other Bowl
into the first bowl you want to add your
cocoa and I'm really just doing this to
I so like I said you can use brown food
coloring but I had cocoa in the cupboard
and it saves me having that extra food
coloring mix it through to make your
cake better light brown and then you
want to add some black coloring to that
either cake batter I'm going to mix that
through to get a really nice black you
want to take a ziplock bag now and spoon
in some of your white and we're also
going to do the same with our black and
also our brown so about half of the wine
that you've got sitting there and then
all of the brown and all of the black
into those ziplock bags beginning with
the leopard print on this side we're
going to start with our vanilla cake mix
so I'm going to snip off quite a
generous tip and make sure you get your
little piece of plastic that you've
snipped off so it doesn't go into your
cake you can see here I'm just swirling
around a really nice thin layer on the
bottom of the cupcake
now you want to snip a slightly smaller
tip off your black once again getting
that piece of plastic out of the way and
then I'm just going to create like a
ring around the outside it doesn't
really matter how thick or thin you do
this but just bear in mind you want this
black to go all the way through all 12
of your Safari cupcakes once you've done
the outer ring you want to do a smaller
ring on the inside of those cupcakes so
you've got kind of like a target looking
thing
now snip the tip off your light brown
and what you're going to do here is
you're essentially going to do the exact
same pattern on top of that black ring
so not beside it literally sitting on
top of it so you've got a layer of black
and then a layer of brown repeat that
for all six of your cupcakes and then
you want to take the black again and
once again on top you want to paint a
black line so you've got black brown and
black this recipe and technique works
quite well with a slightly firmer cake
mix there's something like a pound cake
or even a sponge I prefer a packet mix
for this because I just find them to be
a bit denser now I'm taking my vanilla
cake mix again and I'm swirling I'm
starting in that center will in between
the two layers of black and brown and
then I'm doing the outer well so that I
don't disturb the pattern that we've
created you want to repeat that process
again I'm going to make these ones
slightly thicker so you're going to do
another black layer and then another
brown layer directly on top of that
black layer and then you're going to
finish it off with a final black layer
it's up to you how many of these spots
you want in your cupcakes but you do
want to bear in mind that you don't want
to fill them over two-thirds of the way
so this one here is a little bit full
I'm just going to scoop out a bit of
that vanilla cake mix so as one's are
ready to go for your tiger print
cupcakes you can enter the rest of your
chocolate batter into that remaining
vanilla batter and then just add some
orange food coloring you don't have to
add the chocolate but it just kind of
makes it a little bit of a darker orange
spoon another thin layer of your orange
into the bottom and you'll see I'm using
my spoon to make sure that it's coating
the entire bottom of the cupcake case
and then you want to take that ziplock
bag with the remaining black and you're
going to pipe in just like a big circle
so a little bit smaller than the orange
ring then you want to take another
spoonful and you're going to put a
smaller sized orange ring within the
confines of that black ring and then
you're going to take your ziplock bag
again and you're going to pipe in a
black ring that sits inside the orange
ring so you're kind of building up a
a series of circles another layer of
orange and a final dot of black and
they're ready to go off into a moderate
oven mine took about 12 minutes or so to
cook while they're off cooking you want
to take your food color pastes and put
them in a little container some orange
and some black I'm using paste too not
liquid here because it's better for
drawing on chocolate now I'm just going
to do the little orange spots on my
white candy melts or my white chocolate
buds and I'm just going to ring them on
the outer edge in some black so all
different shapes and sizes for your
spots and when you're ringing them on
the outer edge you want to make sure
that you're not actually joining the
dots up because the leopard spots don't
really join up they've got little gaps
sort of different thicknesses in
different widths now take some of your
black and we're just going to paint some
sort of tiger stripes onto those orange
candy melts these are super super simple
with my target straps I like to do kind
of like one sick one in the middle and
then a few Center ones make sure that
you're pointing them nicely and just a
little bit haphazard if you do need a
guide of course you've got your
printable templates there to help you up
with your patterns once your printable
templates have been printed and I like
to print mine on a 200 GSM card stocks
they're slightly thicker than paper you
just want to wrap them around the
outside of your cupcake and take a
little bit of tape I always curl my tape
underneath the cupcake to give it extra
stability with your cupcakes baked
wrapped in your top is made you now want
to take your piping bag and I'm just
doing a smooth high swirl so you can see
I start in the center of the cupcake I
bring it around lifting it up for about
three layers before tapering off to a
nice point on the top and just sticking
those little Stoppers straight on top so
there you've got your gorgeous super
simple Safari cupcakes Safari on the
inside Safari on the outside make sure
you check out my channel my cupcake
addiction for more surprise inside cake
effects and a whole lot more fabulous
decorating tutorials as always thanks
very much for tuning in to my cupcake
addiction
